chapter.title: User Management
chapter.para: A user must have the administration role to perform these administrator functions, such as create a new user account, assign role(s), and deactivate a users account. The folling sections describes these functions.

section.title: Adding a New User
section.para: To add a new user, select the "View Users" option under the username, which in this case is "admin" in the upper right hand corner, .
The next page will display a list of all the user accounts in Knowledge, as show in . To create a new account select the "New Account" button and enter the required information, refer to .

On the Create a New Account page below, fill in the following information:
Display Name – the name that will be displayed in the upper right corner of the Editor and display as the author in the Editor as well. The Knowledge Manager Homepage will display the User Name in the upper right corner.
User Name – enter the users name. The users name is used to log in.
E-mail – enter the email address associated with the user account.
Password – entering a password is optional
Role – a user can have more than one role, select the role(s) and permissions for this user
Select Create Account to create a new user account.

section.title: Modifying a User's Role
section.para: An administrator can modify a user's role by selecting View Users then selecting Edit. This will bring you to the Edit Account Profile, as shown in for the user. Here, a user's role can be added or removed (a user can have more than one role). A user can be assigned more than one role by selecting multiple user role options. When done modifying a user's role(s) select Save to change the user's permission(s) or select Cancel to cancel the modifications made and return to the previous page. For a description of user roles refer to –

section.title: Disabling a User Account
section.para: The Administrator can also disable a user's account by selecting View Users and then select Edit. This will bring you to the Edit Account Profile select the Disable Account checkbox. Disabling will prevent the user from using their credentials to login to Knowledge – they will no longer have any priviledges in Knowledge. Then select Save to disable the account or select Cancel to cancel the modifications made and return to the View Accounts page.

section.title: Return to Knowledge Homepage
section.para: To return to the Knowledge homepage from View Users go to username, which in this case is "admin" in the upper right hand corner and select Home.
